edu.rit.gpu

Class GpuArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.GpuVbl
      • edu.rit.gpu.GpuArray
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GpuByteArray, GpuDoubleArray, GpuFloatArray, GpuIntArray, GpuLongArray, GpuShortArray, GpuStructArray

    public abstract class GpuArray
extends GpuVbl
    Class GpuArray is the abstract base class for a GPU array variable. This is an array of data stored in the GPU's memory and mirrored in the CPU's memory. Construct an instance of a subclass of class GpuArray by calling a factory method on a Gpu object or a Module object.

    Class GpuArray supports mirroring all of the GPU's data array in the CPU's memory, mirroring only a portion of the GPU's data array in the CPU's memory, or mirroring none of the GPU's data array. Class GpuArray provides operations for copying all or portions of the data array from the CPU to the GPU or from the GPU to the CPU.

    In the GPU memory, the array is implemented as a pointer to an array of N data elements, where N is the length of the array.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the length of the GPU array mirrored in the host CPU's memory.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the GPU array in the GPU device's memory.
        Returns:
        Number of elements in the GPU array.

      • cpuLength

        public int cpuLength()
        Returns the length of the GPU array mirrored in the host CPU's memory.
        Returns:
        Number of elements in the CPU array.

      • hostToDev

        public void hostToDev()
        Copy this GPU array from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory. This is equivalent to the call hostToDev(0,0,cpuLength()).
        Specified by:
        hostToDev in class GpuVbl
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • hostToDev

        public void hostToDev(int len)
        Copy the initial portion of this GPU array from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory. This is equivalent to the call hostToDev(0,0,len).
        Parameters:
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 0 or len > cpuLength().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • hostToDev

        public abstract void hostToDev(int dstindex,
             int srcindex,
             int len)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory. len elements starting at index srcindex in the CPU array are copied to the GPU array starting at index dstindex.
        Parameters:
        dstindex - GPU array starting index.
        srcindex - CPU array starting index.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstindex < 0, srcindex < 0, len < 0, dstindex+len > length(), or srcindex+len > cpuLength().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public void devToHost()
        Copy this GPU array from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory. This is equivalent to the call devToHost(0,0,cpuLength()).
        Specified by:
        devToHost in class GpuVbl
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public void devToHost(int len)
        Copy the initial portion of this GPU array from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory. This is equivalent to the call devToHost(0,0,len).
        Parameters:
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 0 or len > cpuLength().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public abstract void devToHost(int dstindex,
             int srcindex,
             int len)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory. len elements copied starting at index srcindex in the GPU array are copied to the CPU array starting at index dstindex.
        Parameters:
        dstindex - CPU array starting index.
        srcindex - GPU array starting index.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstindex < 0, srcindex < 0, len < 0, dstindex+len > cpuLength(), or srcindex+len > length().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
